Art Gallery - In an era when social distancing is required, visual artists thrive! These works are done by 6-8 art students. It is inspiring how much can be accomplished with remote learning. The best part of the Peru Middle School Emergency Closure Gallery is that it is constantly evolving. Check back in frequently to see new work!

Famous Art Re-creations - As we are all struggling with what to do at home for entertainment, these students are taking cues from old master painters. Students are tasked with choosing an artwork and, using materials found at home, mimic the chosen artwork. The amount of creative thinking that goes into this project is quite impressive (and quite humorous). Families are encouraged to participate!

Feel free to send your own pictures to gbadger@perucsd.org.

We experienced minor delays this morning with student drop off at the high school. As a remedial measure, starting tomorrow morning, the first stop sign on the driveway into the high school will be a yield not a stop. Please watch for pedestrians crossing from the student parking lot to the school side of the driveway. Additionally, to improve the flow of traffic during drop off time, please pull up as far as possible toward the high school cafeteria before dropping students off, then use the left lane to exit.

As an additional factor that may cause delays in both morning arrival and afternoon drop off, road construction has started on Route 22B also know on Pleasant Street. Peru crews are replacing a water line on Pleasant Street and contractors are grinding down and repaving Route 22B from Schuyler Falls to Peru. Please be patient as this will affect buses travelling these routes.
